Events.html: 1272 – While travelling during the Ninth Crusade, Prince Edward becomes King of England upon Henry III of England's death, but he will not return to England for nearly two years to assume the throne.
Events.text: While travelling during the Ninth Crusade, Prince Edward becomes King of England upon Henry III of England's death, but he will not return to England for nearly two years to assume the throne.

Events.html: 1491 – An auto-da-fé, held in the Brasero de la Dehesa outside of Ávila, concludes the case of the Holy Child of La Guardia with the public execution of several Jewish and converso suspects.
Events.text: An auto-da-fé, held in the Brasero de la Dehesa outside of Ávila, concludes the case of the Holy Child of La Guardia with the public execution of several Jewish and converso suspects.

Events.html: 1532 – Francisco Pizarro and his men capture Inca Emperor Atahualpa at the Battle of Cajamarca.
Events.text: Francisco Pizarro and his men capture Inca Emperor Atahualpa at the Battle of Cajamarca.

Events.html: 1632 – Thirty Years' War: Battle of Lützen is fought, the Swedes are victorious but King Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden dies in the battle.
Events.text: Thirty Years' War: Battle of Lützen is fought, the Swedes are victorious but King Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden dies in the battle.

Events.html: 1776 – American Revolutionary War: British and Hessian units capture Fort Washington from the Patriots.
Events.text: American Revolutionary War: British and Hessian units capture Fort Washington from the Patriots.

Events.html: 1776 – American Revolution: The United Provinces (Low Countries) recognize the independence of the United States.
Events.text: American Revolution: The United Provinces (Low Countries) recognize the independence of the United States.

Events.html: 1793 – French Revolution: Ninety anti-republican Catholic priests are executed by drowning at Nantes.
Events.text: French Revolution: Ninety anti-republican Catholic priests are executed by drowning at Nantes.

Events.html: 1797 – The Prussian heir apparent, Frederick William, becomes King of Prussia as Frederick William III.
Events.text: The Prussian heir apparent, Frederick William, becomes King of Prussia as Frederick William III.

Events.html: 1805 – Napoleonic Wars: Battle of Schöngrabern – Russian forces under Pyotr Bagration delay the pursuit by French troops under Joachim Murat.
Events.text: Napoleonic Wars: Battle of Schöngrabern – Russian forces under Pyotr Bagration delay the pursuit by French troops under Joachim Murat.

Events.html: 1822 – American Old West: Missouri trader William Becknell arrives in Santa Fe, New Mexico, over a route that became known as the Santa Fe Trail.
Events.text: American Old West: Missouri trader William Becknell arrives in Santa Fe, New Mexico, over a route that became known as the Santa Fe Trail.

Events.html: 1828 – Greek War of Independence: The London Protocol entails the creation of an autonomous Greek state under Ottoman suzerainty, encompassing the Morea and the Cyclades.
Events.text: Greek War of Independence: The London Protocol entails the creation of an autonomous Greek state under Ottoman suzerainty, encompassing the Morea and the Cyclades.

Events.html: 1849 – A Russian court sentences writer Fyodor Dostoyevsky to death for anti-government activities linked to a radical intellectual group; his sentence is later commuted to hard labor.
Events.text: A Russian court sentences writer Fyodor Dostoyevsky to death for anti-government activities linked to a radical intellectual group; his sentence is later commuted to hard labor.

Events.html: 1852 – The English astronomer John Russell Hind discovers the asteroid 22 Kalliope.
Events.text: The English astronomer John Russell Hind discovers the asteroid 22 Kalliope.

Events.html: 1857 – Second relief of Lucknow – twenty-four Victoria Crosses are awarded, the most in a single day.
Events.text: Second relief of Lucknow – twenty-four Victoria Crosses are awarded, the most in a single day.

Events.html: 1863 – American Civil War: Battle of Campbell's Station near Knoxville, Tennessee – Confederate troops unsuccessfully attack Union forces.
Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Campbell's Station near Knoxville, Tennessee – Confederate troops unsuccessfully attack Union forces.

Events.html: 1885 – Canadian rebel leader of the Métis and "Father of Manitoba" Louis Riel is executed for treason.
Events.text: Canadian rebel leader of the Métis and "Father of Manitoba" Louis Riel is executed for treason.

Events.html: 1904 – English engineer John Ambrose Fleming receives a patent for the thermionic valve (vacuum tube).
Events.text: English engineer John Ambrose Fleming receives a patent for the thermionic valve (vacuum tube).

Events.html: 1907 – Indian Territory and Oklahoma Territory join to form Oklahoma, which is admitted as the 46th U.S. state.
Events.text: Indian Territory and Oklahoma Territory join to form Oklahoma, which is admitted as the 46th U.S. state.

Events.html: 1907 – Cunard Line's RMS Mauretania, sister ship of RMS Lusitania, sets sail on her maiden voyage from Liverpool, England, to New York City.
Events.text: Cunard Line's RMS Mauretania, sister ship of RMS Lusitania, sets sail on her maiden voyage from Liverpool, England, to New York City.

Events.html: 1914 – The Federal Reserve Bank of the United States officially opens.
Events.text: The Federal Reserve Bank of the United States officially opens.

Events.html: 1920 – Qantas, Australia's national airline, is founded as Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services Limited.
Events.text: Qantas, Australia's national airline, is founded as Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services Limited.

Events.html: 1940 – World War II: In response to the leveling of Coventry by the German Luftwaffe two days before, the Royal Air Force bombs Hamburg.
Events.text: World War II: In response to the leveling of Coventry by the German Luftwaffe two days before, the Royal Air Force bombs Hamburg.

Events.html: 1940 – Holocaust: In occupied Poland, the Nazis close off the Warsaw Ghetto from the outside world.
Events.text: Holocaust: In occupied Poland, the Nazis close off the Warsaw Ghetto from the outside world.

Events.html: 1940 – New York City's "Mad Bomber" George Metesky places his first bomb at a Manhattan office building used by Consolidated Edison.
Events.text: New York City's "Mad Bomber" George Metesky places his first bomb at a Manhattan office building used by Consolidated Edison.

Events.html: 1943 – World War II: American bombers strike a hydro-electric power facility and heavy water factory in German-controlled Vemork, Norway.
Events.text: World War II: American bombers strike a hydro-electric power facility and heavy water factory in German-controlled Vemork, Norway.

Events.html: 1944 – World War II: Operation Queen, the costly Allied thrust to the Rur, is launched.
Events.text: World War II: Operation Queen, the costly Allied thrust to the Rur, is launched.

Events.html: 1944 – World War II: Dueren, Germany, is destroyed by Allied bombers.
Events.text: World War II: Dueren, Germany, is destroyed by Allied bombers.

Events.html: 1945 – UNESCO is founded.
Events.text: UNESCO is founded.

Events.html: 1965 – Venera program: The Soviet Union launches the Venera 3 space probe toward Venus, which will be the first spacecraft to reach the surface of another planet.
Events.text: Venera program: The Soviet Union launches the Venera 3 space probe toward Venus, which will be the first spacecraft to reach the surface of another planet.

Events.html: 1973 – Skylab program: NASA launches Skylab 4 with a crew of three astronauts from Cape Canaveral, Florida for an 84-day mission.
Events.text: Skylab program: NASA launches Skylab 4 with a crew of three astronauts from Cape Canaveral, Florida for an 84-day mission.

Events.html: 1973 – U.S. President Richard Nixon signs the Trans-Alaska Pipeline Authorization Act into law, authorizing the construction of the Alaska Pipeline.
Events.text: U.S. President Richard Nixon signs the Trans-Alaska Pipeline Authorization Act into law, authorizing the construction of the Alaska Pipeline.

Events.html: 1974 – The Arecibo Message is broadcast from the Arecibo Radio Telescope in Puerto Rico. It was aimed at the current location of the globular star cluster Messier 13 some 25,000 light years away. The message will reach empty space by the time it finally arrives since the cluster will have changed position.
Events.text: The Arecibo Message is broadcast from the Arecibo Radio Telescope in Puerto Rico. It was aimed at the current location of the globular star cluster Messier 13 some 25,000 light years away. The message will reach empty space by the time it finally arrives since the cluster will have changed position.

Events.html: 1979 – The first line of Bucharest Metro (Line M1) is opened from Timpuri Noi to Semănătoarea in Bucharest, Romania.
Events.text: The first line of Bucharest Metro (Line M1) is opened from Timpuri Noi to Semănătoarea in Bucharest, Romania.

Events.html: 1988 – The Supreme Soviet of the Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic declares that Estonia is "sovereign" but stops short of declaring independence.
Events.text: The Supreme Soviet of the Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic declares that Estonia is "sovereign" but stops short of declaring independence.

Events.html: 1988 – In the first open election in more than a decade, voters in Pakistan elect populist candidate Benazir Bhutto to be Prime Minister of Pakistan.
Events.text: In the first open election in more than a decade, voters in Pakistan elect populist candidate Benazir Bhutto to be Prime Minister of Pakistan.

Events.html: 1989 – A death squad composed of El Salvadoran army troops kills six Jesuit priests and two others at Jose Simeon Canas University.
Events.text: A death squad composed of El Salvadoran army troops kills six Jesuit priests and two others at Jose Simeon Canas University.

Events.html: 1992 – The Hoxne Hoard is discovered by metal detectorist Eric Lawes in Hoxne, Suffolk.
Events.text: The Hoxne Hoard is discovered by metal detectorist Eric Lawes in Hoxne, Suffolk.

Events.html: 1997 – After nearly 18 years of incarceration, the People's Republic of China releases Wei Jingsheng, a pro-democracy dissident, from jail for medical reasons.
Events.text: After nearly 18 years of incarceration, the People's Republic of China releases Wei Jingsheng, a pro-democracy dissident, from jail for medical reasons.
